description: With unrest surging and leaked Council evidence fueling citywide tension, Sven Halek receives urgent requests from both Innovators and free zone organizers to prevent violence and help restore calm.

After consultations, Sven decides against confrontation and instead discreetly triggers Halden’s hidden BCI civic simulation subroutine, preparing an official message inviting every neighborhood to collectively debate Stenograd’s possible futures.
All BCI screens across Stenograd activate, broadcasting Halden’s alternative city histories and potential futures. Crowds gather at displays, their anger redirected into intense yet hopeful debate.
Inspired by the simulations, neighborhood forums and free zone councils organize participatory screenings and debates, guiding discussions about which visions to pursue.

Citizens begin voting on new directions in governance, with neighborhoods experimenting with both mutual-aid and selective restoration of central oversight, gradually reframing Halden’s legacy as a springboard for self-government.
